job_title: Receptionist/Call Center Representative in Westbury, NY
pros: Two weeks of paid training. The supervisors are very professional, and they make you feel welcome.
cons: Unpaid lunch and no overtime. I only get paid 35 hrs. per week. The pay is bi-weekly.

pros: The salaries as a care coordinator are not competitive with the rest of NY.
cons: Bad organization, fast turnover, pay is not good

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Westbury, NY
pros: Structured environment with many policies, clear workflows, mission oriented, warm, and great benefits.
cons: Non-profit does not always have the most competitive salaries.

pros: Some of the staff who work there and their commitment to patient care
cons: Lack of communication and support from senior leadership. Hiring inappropriate individuals for mid-management positions.  Senior leadership only talks among themselves and doesn't trickle down information to all. Lack of transparency and Insufficient PTO
